blocks.name: df-at
blocks.content: Define the set of atoms in a Hilbert lattice. An atom is a nonzero element of a lattice such that anything less than it is zero, i.e. it is the smallest nonzero element of the lattice. Definition of atom in [Kalmbach] p. 15. See ~ ela and ~ elat2 for membership relations. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2002.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ela
blocks.content: Atoms in a Hilbert lattice are the elements that cover the zero subspace. Definition of atom in [Kalmbach] p. 15. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: elat2
blocks.content: Expanded membership relation for the set of atoms, i.e. the predicate "is an atom (of the Hilbert lattice)." An atom is a nonzero element of a lattice such that anything less than it is zero, i.e. it is the smallest nonzero element of the lattice. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm elat2(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cat), wa(wcel(c0, cch), wa(wne(c0, c0h), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h)))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  bitr4i(wcel(c0, cat), wa(wcel(c0, cch), wa(wne(c0, c0h), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h)))))), wa(wcel(c0, cch), wbr(c0h, ccv, c0)))
  ela(c0)
  pm5.32i(wcel(c0, cch), wa(wne(c0, c0h), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))))), wbr(c0h, ccv, c0))
  bitr2d(wcel(c0, cch), wa(wne(c0, c0h), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))))), wbr(c0h, ccv, c0), wa(wpss(c0h, c0), wral(s0, cch, wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cch), wb(wbr(c0h, ccv, c0), wa(wpss(c0h, c0), wral(s0, cch, wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))))), wcel(c0h, cch))
  h0elch()
  cvbr2(s0, c0h, c0)
  anbi12d(wcel(c0, cch), wpss(c0h, c0), wral(s0, cch, wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wne(c0, c0h), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h)))))
  ch0pss(c0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cch), wb(wral(s0, cch, wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wral(s0, cch, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))))))
  ralbiia(s0, cch, wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))))
  3bitr4g(wcel(cv(s0), cch), wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wi(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wi(wne(cv(s0), c0h), wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  imbi2d(wcel(cv(s0), cch), wss(cv(s0), c0), wi(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wi(wne(cv(s0), c0h), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  imbi1d(wcel(cv(s0), cch), wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), c0h))
  ch0pss(cv(s0))
  bitri(wi(wa(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wi(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wi(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  impexp(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  bi2.04(wpss(c0h, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  imbi2i(wss(cv(s0), c0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h)), wi(wne(cv(s0), c0h), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  bitri(wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h)), wi(wne(cv(s0), c0h), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wo(wceq(cv(s0), c0h), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  orcom(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0h))
  neor(cv(s0), c0h, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.c0h.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: elatcv0
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice element is an atom iff it covers the zero subspace. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atcv0
blocks.content: An atom covers the zero subspace. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atssch
blocks.content: Atoms are a subset of the Hilbert lattice. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2002.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atelch
blocks.content: An atom is a Hilbert lattice element. (Contributed by NM, 22-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atne0
blocks.content: An atom is not the Hilbert lattice zero. (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-2002.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atss
blocks.content: A lattice element smaller than an atom is either the atom or zero. (Contributed by NM, 25-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm atss(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat)), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
} = {
  sylan2b(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))), wa(wcel(c1, cch), wa(wne(c1, c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)))))))
  elat2(hs0, c1)
  imp(wcel(c0, cch), wa(wcel(c1, cch), wa(wne(c1, c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)))))), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
  adantld(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cch), wa(wne(c1, c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h))))), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
  adantld(wcel(c0, cch), wne(c1, c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)))), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
  rspcv(hs0, c0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h))), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)), wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h)))
  sseq1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  orbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h), wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))
  eqeq1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  eqeq1(cv(hs0), c0, c0h)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cch)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atss(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)→(c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
} = {
  sylan2b(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ HAtoms, (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)), (c1 ∈ CH ∧(c1 ≠ 0H ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ CH,(hs0 ⊆ c1 →(hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H))))))
  elat2(hs0, c1)
  imp(c0 ∈ CH, (c1 ∈ CH ∧(c1 ≠ 0H ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ CH,(hs0 ⊆ c1 →(hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H))))), (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
  adantld(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ CH, (c1 ≠ 0H ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ CH,(hs0 ⊆ c1 →(hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H)))), (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
  adantld(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ≠ 0H, ∀(hs0 ∈ CH,(hs0 ⊆ c1 →(hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H))), (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
  rspcv(hs0, c0, cch, (hs0 ⊆ c1 →(hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H)), (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c0, hs0 ⊆ c1, (hs0 = c1 ∨ hs0 = 0H), c0 ⊆ c1, (c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H))
  sseq1(hs0, c0, c1)
  orbi12d(hs0 = c0, hs0 = c1, hs0 = 0H, c0 = c1, c0 = 0H)
  eqeq1(hs0, c0, c1)
  eqeq1(hs0, c0, c0h)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cch)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)))
}

blocks.name: atsseq
blocks.content: Two atoms in a subset relationship are equal. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm atsseq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wb(wss(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c1)))
} = {
  impbid1(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  mpd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c1), wne(c0, c0h))
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat), wss(c0, c1), wne(c0, c0h))
  atne0(c0)
  necon1ad(c0, c0h, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c1))
  ord(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat)), wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cat), wcel(c1, cat), wi(wss(c0, c1), wo(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))), wcel(c0, cch))
  atelch(c0)
  atss(c0, c1)
  eqimss(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atsseq(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)→(c0 ⊆ c1 ↔ c0 = c1))
} = {
  impbid1((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0 ⊆ c1, c0 = c1)
  ex((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0 ⊆ c1, c0 = c1)
  mpd(((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)∧ c0 ⊆ c1), c0 = c1, c0 ≠ 0H)
  ad2antrr(c0 ∈ HAtoms, c1 ∈ HAtoms, c0 ⊆ c1, c0 ≠ 0H)
  atne0(c0)
  necon1ad(c0, c0h, ((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)∧ c0 ⊆ c1), c0 = c1)
  ord(((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)∧ c0 ⊆ c1), c0 = c1, c0 = 0H)
  imp((c0 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0 ⊆ c1, (c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H))
  sylan(c0 ∈ HAtoms, c1 ∈ HAtoms, (c0 ⊆ c1 →(c0 = c1 ∨ c0 = 0H)), c0 ∈ CH)
  atelch(c0)
  atss(c0, c1)
  eqimss(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: atcveq0
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice element covered by an atom must be the zero subspace. (Contributed by NM, 11-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm atcveq0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat)), wb(wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wceq(c0, c0h)))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat)), wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wceq(c0, c0h))
  syld(wa(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat)), wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wceq(c0, c0h), wa(wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1)))
  jctild(wa(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat)), wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat), wi(wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wpss(c0, c1)), wcel(c1, cch))
  cvpss(c0, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat), wss(c0h, c0))
  ch0le(c0)
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat), wi(wa(wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c0h)))
  mpd(wa(wcel(c1, cat), wcel(c0, cch)), wi(wa(wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c0h)), wbr(c0h, ccv, c1))
  adantr(wcel(c1, cat), wcel(c0, cch), wbr(c0h, ccv, c1))
  sylan(wcel(c1, cat), wcel(c0, cch), wi(wbr(c0h, ccv, c1), wi(wa(wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c0h))), wcel(c1, cch))
  atelch(c1)
  mp3an1(wcel(c1, cch), wcel(c0, cch), wi(wbr(c0h, ccv, c1), wi(wa(wss(c0h, c0), wpss(c0, c1)), wceq(c0, c0h))), wcel(c0h, cch))
  h0elch()
  cvnbtwn3(c0h, c1, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cat), wi(wceq(c0, c0h), wbr(c0, ccv, c1)))
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c1, cat), wceq(c0, c0h), wbr(c0, ccv, c1), wbr(c0h, ccv, c1))
  atcv0(c1)
  breq1(c0, c0h, ccv, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atcveq0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms)→(c0[<oH]c1 ↔ c0 = 0H))
} = {
  impbid((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0[<oH]c1, c0 = 0H)
  syld((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0[<oH]c1, c0 = 0H, (0H ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊊ c1))
  jctild((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ HAtoms), c0[<oH]c1, 0H ⊆ c0, c0 ⊊ c1)
  sylan2(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ HAtoms, (c0[<oH]c1 → c0 ⊊ c1), c1 ∈ CH)
  cvpss(c0, c1)
  adantr(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ HAtoms, 0H ⊆ c0)
  ch0le(c0)
  ancoms(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ HAtoms, ((0H ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊊ c1)→ c0 = 0H))
  mpd((c1 ∈ HAtoms ∧ c0 ∈ CH), ((0H ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊊ c1)→ c0 = 0H), 0H[<oH]c1)
  adantr(c1 ∈ HAtoms, c0 ∈ CH, 0H[<oH]c1)
  sylan(c1 ∈ HAtoms, c0 ∈ CH, (0H[<oH]c1 →((0H ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊊ c1)→ c0 = 0H)), c1 ∈ CH)
  atelch(c1)
  mp3an1(c1 ∈ CH, c0 ∈ CH, (0H[<oH]c1 →((0H ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊊ c1)→ c0 = 0H)), 0H ∈ CH)
  h0elch()
  cvnbtwn3(c0h, c1, c0)
  adantl(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ HAtoms, (c0 = 0H → c0[<oH]c1))
  syl5ibrcom(c1 ∈ HAtoms, c0 = 0H, c0[<oH]c1, 0H[<oH]c1)
  atcv0(c1)
  breq1(c0, c0h, ccv, c1)
}

blocks.name: h1da
blocks.content: A 1-dimensional subspace is an atom. (Contributed by NM, 22-Jul-2001.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm h1da(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, chba), wne(c0, c0v)), wcel(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), cat))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, chba), wne(c0, c0v)), wcel(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), cat), wcel(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), cch), wa(wne(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h))))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, chba), wne(c0, c0v), wcel(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), cch))
  3syl(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), cch), wss(csn(c0), chba), wcel(cfv(cort, csn(c0)), cch))
  snssi(c0, chba)
  occl(csn(c0))
  choccl(cfv(cort, csn(c0)))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, chba), wne(c0, c0v)), wne(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))), c0h), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)))))
  h1dn0(c0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, chba), wne(c0, c0v), wral(hs0, cch, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h)))))
  ralrimiv(hs0, cch, wcel(c0, chba), wi(wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h))))
  expcom(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cv(hs0), cch), wi(wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0h))))
  h1datom(cv(hs0), c0)
  elat2(hs0, cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, chba))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(c0))))
}

blocks.name: spansna
blocks.content: The span of the singleton of a vector is an atom. (Contributed by NM, 18-Dec-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: sh1dle
blocks.content: A 1-dimensional subspace is less than or equal to any subspace containing its generating vector. (Contributed by NM, 24-Nov-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ch1dle
blocks.content: A 1-dimensional subspace is less than or equal to any member of ` CH ` containing its generating vector. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: atom1d
blocks.content: The 1-dimensional subspaces of Hilbert space are its atoms. Part of Remark 10.3.5 of [BeltramettiCassinelli] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm atom1d(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cat), wrex(s0, chba, wa(wne(cv(s0), c0v), wceq(c0, cfv(cspn, csn(cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  bitr4i(wcel(c0, cat), wrex(s0, chba, wa(wne(cv(s0), c0v), wceq(c0, cfv(cspn, csn(cv(s0)))))), wrex(s0, chba, wa(wne(cv(s0), c0v), wceq(c0, cfv(cort, cfv(cort, csn(cv(s0))))))))
